title: Do you feel that your writing skills have improved more from writing answers for Quora or essays for school? - Quora

response.answer_text: While I am no longer a student, writing essays is by far one of the best ways to build the skill of writing. The problem with quota is that it's built like a social media site, in the sense that you speak how you talk, not how you write. Despite what many teachers tell you, these two should not be the same thing. How you speak is one form of writing, as how you write is another, no one speaks in the way Hemingway wrote, nor Fitzgerald, it's an artform within itself

Writing college level essays helped improve my writing skills. Being responsible to my own ego in writing Quora posts pales in comparison to being responsible for a grade to a college professor who gets paid to call me on my shit. Quora is just for fun.
Yes. I write a lot more tightly now.
Yes. Definitely. Writing answers here sharpen my mind and make my words flow smoothly. It also trains my typing speed.
